rename.to: OBS get stuck while launching on Linux

body: As a related point, it looks like #6577 introduces a hang at exit on FreeBSD for me. (At least, building at fb146fa37084b3e88ce9199e7f0b97dedec2729d -- just before #6577 landed --  consistently exits successfully, while ef6828d31b7b5e2305c1fe810b6fed3d80fa1b46 consistently hangs).

issue.title: OBS hangs at shutdown on FreeBSD after f788e9f

labels.name: Confirmed
labels.description: This bug report has been confirmed by project members

labels.name: Other OS (*nix)
labels.description: Other Unix-like systems that are not officially supported (e.g. OpenBSD)

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Operating System Info

Other

### Other OS

FreeBSD

### OBS Studio Version

Git

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

ef6828d31b7b5e2305c1fe810b6fed3d80fa1b46

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/6yV7v-HoIvbxHIyk

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

OBS exits shortly after clicking "Exit"

### Current Behavior

OBS becomes unresponsive after clicking "Exit"
xfwm reports "This window might be busy and is not responding. Do you want to terminate the application?"

After clicking "Yes" the tail end of the console reports:
```
info: ==== Shutting down ==================================================
info: pulse-am: Stopped Monitoring in 'oss_output.dsp0.monitor'
info: pulse-am: Got 0 packets with 0 frames
info: pulse-am: Stopped Monitoring in 'oss_output.dsp0.monitor'
info: pulse-am: Got 0 packets with 0 frames
info: pulse-input: Stopped recording from 'oss_output.dsp0.monitor'
info: pulse-input: Got 6328 packets with 3183616 frames
info: pulse-am: Stopped Monitoring in 'oss_output.dsp0.monitor'
info: pulse-am: Got 0 packets with 0 frames
Killed
```

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Build ef6828d31b7b5e2305c1fe810b6fed3d80fa1b46 on FreeBSD
2. Start OBS
3. Exit OBS


### Anything else we should know?

I tried building at the commit before #6577 landed (fb146fa37084b3e88ce9199e7f0b97dedec2729d) and OBS exits successfully.

Possibly similar sort of issue as in #7095 but as this is a different OS and different symptom I don't want to introduce confusion in that ticket.

body: My issue in #7109 is caused by f788e9f6b7d27fb30700164db6b1dde6da3cd99e

I tried to reproduce it on my Intel laptop (Wayland) and it never got stuck (tried more than 50 times). So this being a NVIDIA only issue is quiet possible.

Edit: Same under X11

Launching OBS with `QT_QPA_PLATFORM=xcb` makes OBS launch correctly so it seems with Wayland it is not showing a window. (It seems to me there is a regression in OBS because it did work fine with version 28 not long ago)
(Also on Nvidia GPU)
Wrong, the issue happen on X11. Wayland was not tested because it is not supported with NVIDIA GPU by OBS.

I just tried on X11 and OBS is launching fine with Nvidia....

Edit: I am on Gnome 42 if it is relevant

Did you try to launch OBS 28 beta 2, let's say 100 times with 1 chance that OBS get stuck on start up.

When I mean "lucky", it is not a joke.

Ok, that is interesting since it started to work on Wayland as well and randomly failed. Also noticed it won't close when running through the terminal while the issue happens (gets stuck on shutting down)

This issue is related to the startup that got stuck, every other issue should be on another github issue and NVIDIA on Wayland is not supported by OBS (issue related to that will get closed).

Nobody, has reported the same issue on Intel or AMD so we could guess this is NVIDIA only but it's just a guess.

I finally made my `git bissect`, for each step I try to run OBS (start and exit) 100 times maximum.

```
git bisect start
git bisect bad b4f7499b33b53351e56a02fc6194f11d8af78da5  # 28 beta 2
git bisect good 4a64b2aae65dcc40e1d86ec5067532cdf9adcd35 # 28 beta 1
```
> Bisecting: 36 revisions left to test after this (roughly 5 steps)
[cb051240ffde07158c81c2963a795e9a87685410] Merge pull request #6896 from GeorgesStavracas/gbsneto/iconography

Ran OBS 100 times no issue (`git bissect good`).

> Bisecting: 18 revisions left to test after this (roughly 4 steps)
[7f3ea4e00c57db64c171c66ef30c7a3e70a34526] libobs-opengl: Check window creation for errors

Ran OBS 100 times no issue (`git bissect good`).

> Bisecting: 9 revisions left to test after this (roughly 3 steps)
[fb146fa37084b3e88ce9199e7f0b97dedec2729d] libobs: Remove display GPU markers without draws

Ran OBS 100 times no issue (`git bissect good`).

> Bisecting: 4 revisions left to test after this (roughly 2 steps)
[2c43ca1dc61e58bcdda0c62a7db63d68c88d7131] obs-ffmpeg: Add b-frame option to AMF encoder

Ran OBS 41 times and got the issue (`git bissect bad`).

> Bisecting: 2 revisions left to test after this (roughly 1 step)
warning: unable to rmdir 'plugins/obs-websocket': Directory not empty
[0a87797a219e60432616816641fe7bd97e06207b] libobs: Format changes for multiple video mixes

Had to modify `plugins/CMakeLists.txt` to ignore obs-vst.

Ran OBS 21 times and got the issue (`git bissect bad`).

> Bisecting: 0 revisions left to test after this (roughly 0 steps)
[7e39ee291cce955580b00978d2f96c391b05fb72] libobs: Add support for multiple video mixes

Ran OBS 21 times and got the issue (`git bissect bad`).

> 7e39ee291cce955580b00978d2f96c391b05fb72 is the first bad commit
This bug seems to have more chance to happen on Release/RelWithDebInfo builds.
It seems that the Nvidia driver just increase the chance to get the race condition issue.

issue.title: 28 Beta Flatpak doesn't launch correctly via .desktop file

repository.name: obs-studio
repository.description: OBS Studio - Free and open source software for live streaming and screen recording

issue.body:
### Operating System Info

Other

### Other OS

Fedora 36

### OBS Studio Version

28.0.0-beta2

### OBS Studio Version (Other)

_No response_

### OBS Studio Log URL

https://obsproject.com/logs/4PNy6Qu0TuGPMTaO

### OBS Studio Crash Log URL

_No response_

### Expected Behavior

OBS to open successfully when launching via the .desktop file either via the app menu or pinned icon on the taskbar.

Running flatpak run com.obsproject.Studio will actually make this successful

### Current Behavior

OBS icon appears in the taskbar at the bottom then disappears. Trying to launch obs again will note that obs is already running and asks if you want to launch again. If you do, OBS comes up (two instances running at this point, one in the background)

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Launch OBS using the .desktop file via app menu or pinned to taskbar
2. OBS will try to launch, but then appear to fail
3. Trying to launch OBS again will note it's already running, clicking launch anyway will cause it to launch.
...


### Anything else we should know?

Running flatpak run com.obsproject.Studio will actually make this successful.

I checked the .desktop file, I do not see anything out the ordinary there. I have rebooted a few times.
